alert.note: Alert for Gove; Logan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Logan and northwestern Gove Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Russell Springs, or 16 miles southwest of Oakley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Logan and northwestern Gove Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Kansas.
